fields.description:
In mail handler edit wizard, the "Handler" ("Gestionnaire" in French) drop-box values should be improved.

In that context, "non quoted" should be translated as "non cité" or "hors citation".

In that same "Handler" ("Gestionnaire" in French) drop-box, I would recommend to replace verbs in all entries that way:
- original "Ajoutez" -> recommended "Ajouter"
- original "Créez" -> recommended "Créer"
fields.summary: Mail Handler incorrect "quoted" translation

fields.description:
*Original ticket: August 2018 -* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/I18N-2582

There are some Italian translations that are not accurate and need to be re-corrected. Below is the list:-
|English|Current italian Jira|Supposed to be|
|Issue|Problema|Segnalazione|
|Reporter|Reporter |Segnalante|
|Assignee|Incaricato|Assegnatario|
|Customer Request Type|Customer Request Type|?|
|(to) Browse | Esplorare| Sfogliare|
{quote}The main problem arose on the "issue" concept itself.

In the current translation "issue" was translated as "problema", that in italian means "trouble". So, when a user has to "Create an issue", in italian it will appear as a "Create trouble" (hence the hilarious result, in fact a user would search a solution for a problem, but doesn't want to create troubles at all!)

In my previous translation (dated 2016), i used the word "segnalazione", which is near to the more general concept of "ticket" (similar to "request").

In addition think that at least two other terms should be re-translated. Excel file attached.
But beware: in italian (as well as in other languages), female and male word genders exist.
"Problema" is male gender, "Segnalazione" is female; so there are many phrases with adjectives that should also be retranslated according to the word gender.
{quote}
 

*Update: June 30th*

Some time ago we raised an issue (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/I18N-2582) regarding some terms translated in a very questionable way from English to Italian. Now, almost two years later, having made the upgrade of Jira server from 7.11.2 to *8.5.5* (incidentally this version in not even selectable in the Affects Version/s field below), we bitterly discovered that none of our suggestions have been taken into account.

As after the last update, we were forced to perform a full translation of some key terms on all the files contained in the language pack, bringing the situation back to an acceptable level (and I will not hide that it is a long and alienating job, having required 3 full days of work).

I will be able to provide to you the jar file containing our changes, hoping that you can integrate them into future Jira server versions, with the advantage of not having to proceed with the burden of a new translation work on your part (alas, i see that the _Attachement field_ is missing in this Create screen of yours).

This translation contain not only the correct terms, but also verbs and adjectives suitably adapted (as you know italian nouns have gender), and we are currently using it in our production environment.
fields.summary: Italian translation wrong terms and suggested solution

fields.description:
In our product we have this copy:
{code:java}
Add and customize the types of requests this project will use.
 
You can make these request types available in your customer portal by editing your Portal Settings.{code}
Where the "Portal Settings" is a link out to some documentation.
 
We store our strings that need to be translated as follows:
{code:java}
id:'ticket-types-config.header.no-practice-description',
message:
'Add and customize the types of requests this project will use.\nYou can make these request types available in your customer portal by editing your {portalSettingsLink}.',
 
 
id:'ticket-types-config.header.portal-settings-link',
message:'Portal Settings',{code}
 
Unfortunately it's not working in these Chinese translation (see attached image) as the translator seems to have added <link> to the copy.
 
If there is a preferred approach for how we format messages with links, please let me know. Thanks!
fields.summary: Chinese translation's link is not working

fields.description:
Recently we've been working on many projects in the middle east with intrrnational humanitarian organizations that covers the crises in the area so we've noticed how important it is to create this order among all the workers, trainees and volunteers, so after using Trello service for a long period we found out how important it is to make the Arab individuals who lacks the ability to understand English language actually get involved with all the boards we have for efficient communication and organization. Considering this request will help Atlassian too by reaching for all this developing countries and start building order out of all this chaos. We hope that you take this request in consideration so we both grow up together and reach this noble cause.

Thanks in advance for all this great services you are offering to make the world a better place to live.
fields.summary: Adding Arabic language feature for Trello interface
Incorrect Vietnamese / Chinese translation in Notification Distributor

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While creating a Jira Issue Macro in a Confluence Server instance, the header information of the Jira Issue will be translated depending on web browser language configuration for the user.

We have found out that the specific fields Fix version/s and Component/s in English (United Kingdom) will be translated to Fix version(s) and Component(s) in English (United States).

This can cause discrepancies when using advanced filtering and third-party add-ons that rely on an immutable translation of these fields to retrieve the information. It is also confusing for the end-users.

h3. Environment

Latest Confluence Server 7.5.2 connected to a Jira instance v8.0.0 via application link
To reproduce the issue I used Chrome Version 83.0.4103.106 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

To visualize the issue:
# Create a Jira Issue Macro on a Confluence page (recording attached). You need to make sure that Component/s and Fix version/s has been correctly configured on the Jira side for the project. I made them mandatory fields on the Jira end.
# Set the default language in web browser to be either English (United Kingdom) or English (United States)

h3. Expected Results

We expect to have a consistent translation between English (United Kingdom) and English (United States).

h3. Actual Results

Specific fields Fix version/s, Component/s and Affects Version/s in English (United Kingdom) will be respectively translated to Fix version(s) and Component(s) and Affects Version(s) in English (United States)

h3. Workaround

Still in the process of checking this. Manually modifying the JAR file that includes the translation of such fields in the Jira Metadata Plugin in Confluence can be an option.

h3. Notes

This translation is specifically impacting the use of third-party plugin *[Table Filter and Charts for Confluence v5.3.17 by StiltSoft|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27447/table-filter-and-charts-for-confluence]* and Pivot Table macro. Depending on the browser language setting, the result displayed to end-users will be different.
fields.summary: Incorrect translation of specific Jira Issue fields in Confluence Jira Issue Macro

fields.description:
As reported here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71059

Translation for the word "edit sprint" in German is incorrect in the Jira platform. In German, it is translated as "End sprint".

This is very confusing for users and admins.

 

Affected version is 8.8 - but is not selectable.

fields.description:
When moving issues from Backlog to an active sprint, the warning message for scope change contains two errors in French.

1- The title uses 'demande' instead of 'ticket' which is used elsewhere in Jira:
Actual: Déplacer la demande
Suggested: Déplacer le ticket

2- The message for moving issue to sprint use 'de le' instead of 'du':
Actual: 'Issue key' sera déplacé de le backlog vers sprint 'Sprint name'.
Suggested: 'Issue key' sera déplacé du backlog vers sprint 'Sprint name'.
fields.summary: When moving issue from Backlog to active sprint, the warning message contains French language errors.

fields.description: When using the French Jira translation, the word 'Gadget' can appear both as 'Portlet' or 'Gadget' in dashboards, when ideally using a single word 'Gadget' would be better to keep it consistent through the User Interface.

fields.description:
Steps to get to the error:
1- Change the language to French and open an issue other than sub-task
2- Click on 'More', then 'Convert to sub-task'

The title for each step contain errors.
Actual: Etape 1 sur 4
Suggested: Étape 1 de 4

The same for steps 2 to 4.
fields.summary: When converting an issue to sub-task in French, the titles contain translation error

fields.description:
On the Projects page, a recently visited Jira Service Desk project is given the subtitle "Klassiskt projekt av typen programvara" which translates as "Classic project of type software," despite it being a service desk project. I've attached screenshots of this in both English and Swedish to show that this is happening.

My suggestion is that it should instead be translated as "Klassiskt kundtjänst-projekt" (Classic customer service project) as that lines up with the dropdown given for the fast project switcher when you've clicked into the project (as also attached). It's also shorter, which will make it readable without needing to hover over it.
fields.summary: Swedish translation incorrectly translates project card subtitle on Projects page

Suggested: Document, Travail externe, Migration, Ressource, Autre

The error message misses an "e" at the end.
Actual: Raison du suspens est requis.
Suggested: Raison du suspens est requise.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Translations to Slovak language is not happening properly in Jira Service Desk.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the default system language to Slovak

h3. Expected Results

Example: 
 Expected: [USER] schválil(a) túto požiadavku.
 Stav Vašej požiadavky sa zmenil z [Previous Status] na [Status]

 
h3. Actual Results

Actual: [USER] schválené táto požiadavka.
 Your request was SCHVÁLENÉ and the status changed to V realizácii

The first one [USER] schválené táto požiadavka, is grammatically not correct. Its like you would say "User the issue approved".
 The second is not translated at all.
 There are lot of other grammar related errors that would convey a different meaning in Slovak language.

(i)+_Screenshots attached explaining the above_+
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Translations to Slovak language is not happening properly in Jira Service Desk.

fields.description:
After selecting a project and go to the Backlog, there is a '+ create issue' we can click on. After clicking on '+Create issue', it reads 'Nouvelle Récit dans Backlog', but Récit is masculin and should use 'Nouveau' instead. Same situation for 'Cas de Test' and 'Plan de Test'.

 

Actual: 'Nouvelle Récit dans Backlog', Nouvelle Cas de test dans Backlog', 'Nouvelle Plan de test dans backlog'

Suggested: 'Nouveau Récit dans backlog', 'Nouveau Cas de test dans Backlog', 'Nouveau Plan de test dans Backlog'
(Please see attached screenshot)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Translation of error message in German is inaccurate.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as UserA
# Login as UserB in another browser or machine
# Switch Jira language to German
# Navigate to Jira Software board > Backlog for both UserA and UserB
# As UserA, view an issue in a new browser tab
# As UserA, edit the 'Security Level' of the issue to allow only you to be able to view the issue
(i) UserB is still in the Jira Software Backlog view
# Without refreshing the page, UserB views the issue that has just been updated by UserA
(!) UserB should not be able to view the issue as it is now restricted to UserA
# Note the error message

h3. Expected Results
Error returned with the following message: 
{quote}
*Fehler*
Sie haben nicht die Berechtigung, den Vorgang zu sehen.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Error returned with the following message: 
{quote}
*Fehler*
Sie haben nicht die Berechtigung, den den Vorgang zu sehen.
{quote}

(i) There is an extra "den" in the error message 

!board_error_translation_German.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inaccurate German translation on error in Jira Software board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Italian content of “Text Formatting Notation Help” is broken.
 It throws an exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: can't parse argument number: anchor:qua
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Set the language to Italian from [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 * Navigate to:
 ** https://<URL>.atlassian.net/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=advanced
 ** https://<URL>.atlassian.net/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=miscellaneous

h3. Expected Results

The page is showing without any error
h3. Actual Results

Exception error is shown.
{code:java}
Exception rendering velocity file com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.jirarenderers:atlassian-wiki-renderer-help-action//templates/plugins/renderers/wiki/wiki-renderer-notation-help.vm

org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Invocation of method 'getText' in class com.atlassian.jira.web.action.renderers.wiki.WikiRendererHelpAction threw exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: can't parse argument number: anchor:qua at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.jirarenderers:atlassian-wiki-renderer-help-action//templates/plugins/renderers/wiki/wiki-renderer-notation-help.vm[line 319, column 41]
at com.atlassian.velocity.JiraVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(JiraVelocityManager.java:87)
at com.atlassian.velocity.JiraVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(JiraVelocityManager.java:63)
at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:127)

{code}
h3. Workaround

Change to different language (ie. English) from Personal settings
fields.summary: The Italian content of “Text Formatting Notation Help” is broken

fields.description:
1) The CTAs on the "Request trial" modal (screenshot attached) aren't fully translated into German. They say "Request a trial" and "Close" in English. Moreover, the lozenge "Inactive on your site" is also not translated.

*Steps to get there*: Open Jira project > project side nav bar > click on "On-call schedules" tab > click on "Request a trial".

2) The "More info" page is so poorly translated that I can't pick anything in particular. It reads like a Google Translate translation. 

*Steps to get there*: Open Jira project > project side nav bar > click on "On-call schedules" tab > click on "More info".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In JIRA there is an issue type: Story
'User story'
Polish translation of 'User story' is 'Historyjka użytkownika'.

So better translation is
(English version) Issue type: Story
(Polish version) Typ zgłoszenia: Historyjka

This translation reflects the meaning of 'Story' in the sense of 'User story'

It is a possibility to change polish translation?

h3. Expected Results

Current translation in Jira Software Server is:
(English version) Issue type: Story / (Polish version) Typ zgłoszenia: Historia

Expected Results Suggested translation is:
(English version) Issue type: Story / (Polish version) Typ zgłoszenia: *Historyjka*
fields.summary: Issue type "Story" translates wrong in Polish

h3. Issue Summary

When using Russian localisation with Confluence Questions plug-ins, several words have typos in them
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Confluence Questions plug-in
 # Create a question
 # Open it and add comment
 # Have a look at Watch button in the top right corner
 # Click on "green checkbox" to accept answer on the bottom left

h3. Expected Results

1. Watch button should be "Прекратить наблюдение"
 2. Accept answer should be "Принять ответ"
h3. Actual Results

1. "Прекратить налюдение", the letter "б" in the second word is missing
 !watch.png|width=258,height=101! 
 2. "Приянть ответ", in the first word, the letters "н" and "я" must be interchanged
 !accept answer.png|width=268,height=123!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
My issue is the following with the French (France) language pack :
Ticket is borrowed from English and therefore not an official translation it is only used in France and is not international, they are officially accepted but not used.
The good translation for that would be "Demande" or "Billet" and "Demandes" or "Billets" for plurals.

France tends to use multiple borrowed words from English that are "officially" accepted but not used internationally, such words would include the following :

English : T-Shirt , French : Chandail
English : Shopping , French : Magasinage
English : Chewing Gum , French : Gomme balloune
English : Cookie , French : Biscuit
English : Washing Cabins , French : Toilettes
English : Tickets , French : Demandes/Billets
And we could go on and on.
Can you please make an update regarding this as in earlier versions of Jira it was correctly translated with French (France) official language pack. It bugs me as this was correct in earlier versions.
Attached is a draft of all the translations mishap that I could find, I generated it with InProduct Translation.
fields.summary: Strings in English while using French language pack

*English source:*

We can attempt to match Cloud users with the equivalent users in this site using their email address, if available. Alternatively you can choose to attribute all content to 'unknown user'. Both options have implications for permissions and restrictions that you should understand before importing the space.

*Current French translation:* 

Nous pouvons essayer de faire correspondre les utilisateurs du Cloud avec les utilisateurs équivalents sur le site à {color:#FF0000}laide{color} de leur adresse électronique, le cas échéant. Vous pouvez également choisir {color:#FF0000}dattribuer{color} tout le contenu à un « utilisateur inconnu ». Les deux options ont des incidences en termes {color:#FF0000}dautorisations{color} et de restrictions, que vous devez comprendre avant {color:#FF0000}dimporter lespace{color}.
fields.summary: Missing apostrophes in French translation in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Apply a custom field of date time picker type to a project's create issue screen
 # Set the UI language to Japanese
 # Click the + button in the sidebar to create a issue
 # Enter the summary, pick a date from the custom field and click "Create"

h3. Expected Results

Process will proceed as expected(in this case, an issue will be created)
h3. Actual Results

An error is showing saying an invalid format is entered.
 Checking the network console, POST /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa?decorator=none is returning 400 error


h3. Workaround
 * change the UI to English at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 * proceed without entering the data and fill it in after the issue is created
 * use Date picker instead of Date Time picker
 * replace "AM" "PM" with "午前" "午後" respectively
fields.summary: Unable to create issue if date time picker field is used in Japanese UI

fields.description: The "You make changes to the issue" option is to configure whether to receive their own updates. However, the "You" is not translated and the translation is read as "Changes have been made to issue". This is very confusing and doesn't show the objective of this option.
fields.summary: Misleading translation

fields.description: We've made a product decision to allow the bring back the TinyMCE editor for some customers. However, this decision isn't reflected in the translation in some of the create dialogues
fields.summary: Update Wording of Create Dialogue in German

fields.description:
My team got a user feedback about a minor mistake in a Swedish text:

"In Swedish, it says "Tack för din kommentar/!"
The backslash shouldn't be there."

[https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PTDF/queues/custom/151/PTDF-3629]
fields.summary: Minor mistake in a Swedish text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an issue with the logout message in German language.

The text is:
"Sie sind jetzt abgemeldet. Jedwede automatische Anmeldung wurde ebenfalls gestoppt."
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Run jira in a German Environment and check the message after logout.
h3. Expected Results

The text should be:
"Sie sind jetzt abgemeldet. Jede automatische Anmeldung wurde ebenfalls gestoppt."
h3. Actual Results

Below is the message on logout screen:
{noformat}
"Sie sind jetzt abgemeldet. Jedwede automatische Anmeldung wurde ebenfalls gestoppt."
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Problem with logout message in German Language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The german translation for the word "Email" is wrong in the Jira Cloud. The German word for "Email" is "Email" itself whereas the word "Senden Sie" is used for Email across Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Personal Settings --> Set Language to Deutsch
 # Go to Issue Collector of a project.
 # Check the Email field. It is Wrongly translated as Senden Sie
 # Also, same translation is used if in channel field for Jira Service Desk tickets.

h3. Expected Results

The word "Email" is used for "Email".
h3. Actual Results

The word "Senden Sie" is used.
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation of "Email"

fields.description:
The source sentence is structured as: <Copy> <the link> to <this issue>

However the Japanese translation is saying <Copy> <the link to this issue>
fields.summary: "Copy the link to this issue" translation error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is getting wrong translation of word "login" in slovak language
 In Jira, the translation for "Login" is currently "Prihlasiť sa", but the correct word would be "Prihlásiť sa" (Please refer attached Screenshot)
 Affected Version: 4.5.0 Jira Service Desk

!prihlasiť chyba.png|width=722,height=269!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Login to jira, it will show the login work incorrectly when user default language is slovak.
h3. Expected Results

he correct word would be "Prihlásiť sa"
h3. Actual Results

* "Login" is currently showing as "Prihlasiť sa" in jira login page.

* cv.login.pub.create.account should not be "Prihlásiť sa do konta" *_but change it to: "Registrovať nové konto"_*
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wrong translation of word "Login" in Slovak Language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even changing the site language, the profile language or translate the statuses in Jira, the message that the ticket was approved or declined will not be translated to the current language.
From the agent view, it is also not translated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a workflow approval step;
# Change your profile language;
# Approve a ticket and check the comments section.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will translate the entire sentence to your profile language.

h3. Actual Results

Jira translates the sentence partially and leaves the status name with the language that it was created.
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-02 at 16.15.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approval steps are not translated to any language when it is approved or declined

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Localisation missing for the content of the "General service desk" option when creating a new JSD Cloud project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Atlassian account language default to Japanese
 # Create a new staging instance via go/try, Jira Service Desk only
 # Click the project create button on the landing page (in Japanese, "プロジェクト作成")

h3. Expected Results

All cards are translated.
h3. Actual Results
 # !image-2020-04-02-15-16-26-184.png|width=765,height=599!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a new project in Jira Service Desk is missing a Japanese localisation for the "General service desk" option

fields.description:
h4. Summary

The [Atlassian Support Portal|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] is only available in three languages as of the creation of this request, including English:
 * Portuguese (português -Brasil)
 * Japanese (日本語)

_Reference: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/translations] as of 31 March 2020_

We offer translation support in the following languages:
 * Chinese (中文 - 中国)
 * Czech (čeština)
 * Danish (dansk)
 * Dutch (Nederland)
 * Estonian (eesti)
 * Finnish (suomi)
 * French (français)
 * German (Deutsch - Deutschland)
 * Hungarian (magyar)
 * Icelandic (islenska)
 * Italian (italiano)
 * Japanese (日本語)
 * Korean (한국어)
 * Norwegian (norsk, bokmål)
 * Polish (polski)
 * Portuguese (português -Brasil)
 * Romanian (română)
 * Russian (русский)
 * Slovak (slovenčina)
 * Spanish (español - España)
 * Swedish (svenska)

h4. Suggestion

Provide the ability to translate the Support Portal into the customer's selected profile language for ease of use.
h4. Notes

We are not able to provide support in all of the listed languages, so we would need a solution for that. For example:

A disclaimer that our teams provide support in specific languages. Reference: [Atlassian Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-offerings-193299636.html].
{quote}*Support does not include*: support in languages other than English, Japanese, and Portuguese.
{quote}
Otherwise, we'd need some way to translate customer requests on-the-fly, but that can be unreliable.
fields.summary: Translate the Support Portal into Supported Languages

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence Cloud for Slack app(https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html) is provided only in English.
Since the product itself is provided in [several languages|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html], it would be great if the Slack app is localized as well.

Ref: https://api.slack.com/start/designing/localizing#what
fields.summary: Localize the Confluence Cloud for Slack app

fields.description:
Issue Summary
The german translation for the word "changed" is wrong in the Jira Service Desk customer notifications. The status changed notification uses the wrong german word for "changed" in the email template. The German word for "changed" is "geändert" whereas the email template uses the word "genabnet"
Steps to Reproduce
Enable notifications for status changed and use german language pack.
Change the status of a ticket to get an email notification. 
Expected Results
The word "geändert" is used for "changed".
Actual Results
The word "genabnet" is used.
Workaround

via https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8965
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation of "changed"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing the language to "Tiếng Việt", some information on the site is not rendered correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your profile language to Tiếng Việt
 # Go to the system dashboard in Jira or to a Backlog on a Classic project

h3. Expected Results

All information in Jira is correctly translated to the selected language.
h3. Actual Results

It shows some characters between the letters.

!Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 14.08.59.png|width=356,height=293!

!Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 14.22.20.png|width=415,height=154!

!Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 14.23.14.png|width=467,height=186!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gadgets, backlog, status and other information are not rendered correctly when using Vietnamese language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When description is defined for priorities/issue types and translated to English US as per the below screenshot, other users when having their default profile language set to English US, sees the same description Users when having their default profile language set to English UK, sees the description different.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Translated the priority descriptions to English US. When default language is in English US, works as expected. Changed default language to English UK  Priority description shows different comments.

h3. Expected Results
Priority/Issue type description should show as it is set in the description.

h3. Actual Results
Descriptions are not showing as how it is set.

h3. Workaround
Create new priorities and set the descriptions as this issue only persist with the default priorities.
This has been observed for Issue types as well.
fields.summary: Translations for priorities, statuses and Issue types are not working

fields.description:
@jascha sittel has flagged that the Service Registry UI is showing in English.

 

After speaking to [~dchan4@atlassian.com], I can see the strings associated to this feature (listed below) are localized and published in Smartling. This should therefore be showing as localized in the UI.

 
 * servicedesk-services.service-registry - The service list title
 * servicedesk-services.service-list.name - The service list table headings
 * servicedesk-services.service-list.tier
 * servicedesk-service-details.description-heading - Service details view field headings
 * servicedesk-service-details.tier-heading

!image-2020-03-18-16-19-43-148.png!
fields.summary: JSD Cloud Service Registry UI showing in English

fields.description: The text is currently translated as "1 was finished sprint" which doesn't make sense. I suspect it's because the number would be a message variable in the source text and led to some confusion!
fields.summary: Incorrect translation for number of finished sprints in JSW bento view for Swedish

fields.description:
As per: [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/FSD-4244]

The Portuguese translation for change in the navbar uses a word that's more like alter than change. Also, the word that was used is not the standard for change management in the Brasilian IT market.

Also change management configuration translation feels  !image-2020-03-17-17-07-15-278.png! weird.
fields.summary: Incorrect terminology in pt-BR for Change management

fields.description:
*サイトへのアクセス可* (original text: *Has access on site*) makes sense but a little bit confusing especially if the user's site access is disabled. So the text should be replaced with *サイトへのアクセス可否*.

 !Screenshot 2020-03-13 10.55.06.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Japanese text correction: *サイトへのアクセス可否*

    • {code}

fields.description:

  • Preskočiť na obsah
  • Prejsť na mininavigáciu
  • Prejsť do ponuky hlavičky
  • Prejsť do ponuky akcií
  • Preskočiť na rýchle vyhľadávanie

fields.description:
Czech skip links have one link inconsistent (Přeskočit, while others use Přejít): {code}
  • Přejít na obsah
  • Přeskočit na drobečkovou navigaci
    • <--- Should also use "Přejít"
  • Přejít na hlavičku menu
  • Přejít na menu akcí
  • Přejít na rychlé vyhledávání
    • {code}
fields.summary: Skip link Czech translations

fields.description:
h3.Steps # Change user language to Spanish # Go to the Dashboard # Inspect source code or use screen reader *What happened...* The jump links are translated using two different verbs ("ir" and "saltar"): {code}
  • Ir al contenido
  • Saltar al historial
  • Saltar al encabezado del menú
  • Saltar al menú de acciones
  • Ir a la búsqueda rápida
{code} *What should have happened...* The links should consistently use "Go to" (Ir a) or "Skip to" (Saltar a), not mix them. This is what they look like in English, they are all the same and that should equally apply to other languages: {code}
  • Skip to content
  • Skip to breadcrumbs
  • Skip to header menu
  • Skip to action menu
  • Skip to quick search
{code}
fields.summary: Skip link Spanish translations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The registration email sent to customers who self-sign up to a Jira Service Desk in Russian receive an email with contradicting information.

The signup email in Russian says:
{noformat}
Все почти готово!

Перейдите по ссылке ниже, чтобы завершить регистрацию на Центр поддержки. В целях безопасности не переходите по этой ссылке.
{noformat}
Translated to English this means:
{noformat}
Everything is almost done!

Follow the link below to complete the registration to the Support Center. For security reasons, do not click on this link.
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the default language of a Jira Service Desk project to Russian.
 # Set browser language to Russian.
 # Self-sign up on the Service Desk customer portal (sitename.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/signup?destination=portals)

h3. Expected Results

The email should contain the correct Russian translation of the English version which is
{noformat}
Almost done!

Follow the link below to finish signing up to Help Center. For security, don't share this link with anyone.
{noformat}
h3. Actual Results

The Russian language email tells the customer to not click the link in the email.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: JSD customer portal signup confirmation email in Russian has incorrect translation

fields.description:
When I use my Jira translated to Czech, strings "Today" and month names in sprint reports are in English.

 

!image-2020-03-06-14-37-41-903.png!
fields.summary: "Today" and month names in sprint report are not translated

fields.description:
"Deze issue" - this translation should be "dit issue aan je" and plural would be "deze issues aan je"

!ESRUaV-XkAARQ-P.png!
fields.summary: Incorrect translation in Dutch Jira issue summary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new Jira Issue view, the *Activity* tab is not translated to any language and remains on English.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the *Language* in your [Account Preferences|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 # Go to Jira and open any Issue in the new view

h3. Expected Results

Everything should be translated according to the language selected in your [Account Preferences|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences].

h3. Actual Results

Everything is translated except for the *Activity* tab of the Issue.

 !_KFF-20__Test_issue_type_bug_import_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Switch to the old issue view.
fields.summary: The Activity tab is not being translated in new Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
German translation in 6.15.9 is not really correct and can create confusion for users 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.15.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence in English
# Check the main Dashboard there is a tab called "Saved for later"
# Check any page you have access to, you will find a star menu called "Save for later" 
# Change your personal settings to Deutsch
# Check the main Dashboard, the "Saved for later" tab is "Gespeichert für später"
# Check any page you have access to, the "Save for later" button is "Favorit"

h3. Expected Results

Using Deutsch, we expect to see "Save for later" to be  "Speichern für später"

h3. Actual Results

"Save for later" button is "Favorit" which is not a correct translation.
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Save for later" wrong translation in German

fields.description:
As a someone with JSD project admin role, go to request type form and try to inline-edit the request type's name, description, or icon. The Chinese translation of the button on the right says '无效的请求类型', which is 'Invalid request type'.

Our original English message is 'Update request type', though.

Key of the i18n message is `sd.admin.request.edit.action.update`. The i18n file name is `sd-i18n.properties`.

Please refer to the attached images for the correct English message & the incorrect Chinese translation on the same page.
fields.summary: Chinese translation for 'Update request type' (under JSD Project Setting > Request type form) is wrong

fields.description:
Multiple Issue Types and their corresponding descriptions are displaying in English. I have found that the text currently showing in English in the UI is not in Smartling, whereas strings with the keys below are localized. This indicates we have hardcoded label names and descriptions.
 * jira.translation.issuetype.... name
 * jira.translation.issuetype....desc
fields.summary: Jira "Issue types" and descriptions partially hard coded.

fields.description:
Multiple labels and their corresponding descriptions are displaying in English. I have found that the text currently showing in English in the UI is not in Smartling, whereas strings with the keys below are localized. This indicates we have hardcoded label names and descriptions.
 * jira.translation.status....name
 * jira.translation.status....desc

Links to: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-458895|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-458895?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=6bedfc3d-29c9-4a16-90a9-aba3f1406088]

cc: [~dwoo@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Jira status labels and descriptions partially hard coded.

fields.description:
On JSD, we've noticed a missing translation on 'Project Links' - I've attached a screenshot of the missing translation. 

This looks to be coming from Jira and not Service desk as we have also check the project links on software projects.
fields.summary: Missing translation on Project Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When looking through the list in 'Space Directory' the *Prev* and *Next* are not translated to German.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few spaces enough to have the result spill over to the 2nd page when viewing through the list in Space Directory, you'd see that *Prev* and *Next* are not translated to German.

h3. Expected Results
*Prev* and *Next* should be translated to German equivalent.
h3. Actual Results
*Prev* and *Next* are shown as is, in English.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translation issues: 'Prev' and 'Next' in Space Directory are not translated to German
When modifying "Epic Link"and the message after "Epic Link" are not translated in French
Problems with apostrophes when working in French

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer found the translation of a Korean character is incorrect. It's in the Email notification from Team Calendar.

The translation of Korean is located in the below file:
 * team-calendars-6.0.27.jar/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/calendar3/calendar3_ko_KR.properties

And the translation of the title is the following:
 * calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\uD300 \uCE98\uB9B0\uB354\{color:#4c9aff}uBC00\uB9AC \uC54C\uB9BC

The translation of *\uBC00 (밀)* should be changed to *\uBBF8 (미)*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create an email notification. And check the title of notification like below image:
 !teamcalendars.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Korean: 팀 캘린더 미리 알림
 Unicode Translation:
 calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\uD300 \uCE98\uB9B0\uB354 \uBBF8\uB9AC \uC54C\uB9BC
h3. Actual Results

Korean: 팀 캘린더 밀리 알림
 Unicode Transaltion:
 calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\uD300 \uCE98\uB9B0\uB354 \uBC00\uB9AC \uC54C\uB9BC
h3. Workaround

No workaround.

h3.Note
I have checked the latest version 6.0.48 has the same issue.
fields.summary: A Korean translation on Email notification from Team Calendar is incorrect.

fields.description:
_Key: issue.request-raised_

The Japanese translation below does not make sense:
Melanie Heighway が以下を通じて リクエストを作成しました Jira
 
It should be something like:
Melanie Heighway が Jira を使用してリクエストを作成しました
 
Japanese:
!image-2020-02-27-17-09-51-216.png|width=544,height=186!
English:
!image-2020-02-27-17-10-44-183.png|width=495,height=185!

Redundant text: There's

fields.description:
The strings:
 # Kind
 # Priority
 # Title !image-2020-02-24-18-26-00-771.png!

Are hardcoded, as per the attached images. The will need to be provided in the Bitbucket strings file for be localized

Support ticket: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/BBS-128289?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=c54993f7-fe15-418d-8657-57f7e5fd59d8]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I've created a custom workflow for my service desk project (JSD Cloud - next gen) but not all statuses are displaying in the translation screen.
Statuses that cannot be translated are shown in English even if the language is set to French. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User has set default language as English 
 # User creates a custom workflow 
 # User adds transitions & statuses in English 
 # Go to language support to add a French translation

h3. Expected Results

Language support provides full set of options to translate to French. Workflow is fully translated to French 
h3. Actual Results

Workflow shows a mix of French & English 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually create the custom statuses/ transitions in French or try in Classic project.
fields.summary: Custom workflow in JSD Cloud results in not all statuses/ transitions being translated

fields.description: There is a customer reported that the "Send" button in JSD Portal is not translated correctly in Finnish, more info https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8900

Incorrect German translation of the "Resolve this issue" button on Resolve issue screen:

 # Go to an issue > transition issue to "Resolved", a screen will pop-up.

h3. Expected Results

The correct translation of "Resolve this issue" button should be: *Umgesetzt*


h3. Actual Results

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! -->  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

None

Creating based off user report in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/quot-Next-Generation-quot-Project-Feature-Preview-Translation/qaq-p/1299442

It seems the term "Folgende" is incorrect here.  From the post:
{quote}
The translation in the features tour is bad.

A proper translation for that button would be "Weiter" (continue in english) or "mehr" (more in english)
{quote}

Jira Cloud next-gen project

 
h3. Notes
-

fields.description: At the moment, there is no translation available for the Thai language in Jira cloud. It would be beneficial for Thai customers if the translation will be available for this language.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are incorrect translations on the create/edit/view issue screen for the French translations.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Click on *Create (Creér)* on the bar at the top of the screen.

h3. Expected Results

Several items are not translated or not properly translated:

1- Labels – Now: Etiquettes – Should be: Étiquette (Missing accent on letter 'E' ).

2- Description – Now: Descriptif – Should be: Description (wrong translation).

3- Epic Link – Now: Epic Link – Should be: Lien d'épopée (Not translated).

4- Choose an epic to assign this issue to – Should be: Choisissez une épopée à laquelle attribuer ce ticket (Not translated).

5- Start typing to get a list of possible matches – Now: Commencer à taper pour obtenir une liste de correspondances possibles – Should be: Commencez à taper… (Should read 'Commencez' instead of 'Commencer').

h3. Actual Results

Several items are not translated or not properly translated:

1- Labels – Now: Etiquettes 
2- Description – Now: Descriptif 
3- Epic Link – Now: Epic Link 
4- Choose an epic to assign this issue to
5- Start typing to get a list of possible matches 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect field translations for the French language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Create* button is not translated on specific screens. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click on *Créer (Create)* on the bar at the top of the screen.
# You should be takent to: <Base_URL>/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa
# Select the *Projet (Project)* and *Type de ticket (Issue Type)*.
# Click on *Suivant*.
# You should be taken to the following URL: <Base_URL>/secure/CreateIssue.jspa
# Scroll down and at the bottom of the page you should see the *Create* (untranslated) button.

(x) Note: If you are taken to the *Créer un ticket* page directly (without clicking on Suivant), then the issue is not reproducible.

h3. Expected Results

You should see *Créer* instead of *Create*.

h3. Actual Results

You see *Create*.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create button is not translated to French on a screen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a misspelling in Confluence Swedish language pack for Blueprint. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Found a spelling mistake in the Swedish language pack for Confluence.

The translation for the blueprint for Retrospective has an extra S in it - "Re*s*trospektiv".

Correct spelling should be "Retrospektiv".

Issue exists in both 6.12.2 (prod environment) and 7.2.1 (test environment).
h3. Expected Results

Correct spelling should be "Retrospektiv".
h3. Actual Results

"Re*s*trospektiv"
h3. Workaround
h5. Change the string from the JAR file
 * Download language pack from [packages.atlassian.com|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven/com/atlassian/translations/?_ga=2.4088496.1266593924.1540749370-265030796.1518690225] for applicable version. (There are language packs available for each release).
 * Unpack the jar file and modify the string.
 * Pack everything back into a jar file.
 * Upload jar file using Confluence plugin manager.

You can read more about the translation in [Atlassian Translations - Atlassian Translations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TRANS/Atlassian+Translations].
fields.summary: Misspelling in Swedish translation for Blueprint

fields.description:
The string "I *make changes* to the issue" is not translated to chinese

!image-2020-02-17-12-14-02-702.png!
fields.summary: The string "I make changes to the issue" is not translated in instance personal setting

fields.description: I've seen a couple of customers report in JSD next-gen that sometimes their letters aren't displaying correctly. This occurs both when the default language is set to Romanian and also when the Romanian language support is on. I've attached a screenshot to show what it currently looks like for customers.
fields.summary: Some letters in Romanian are not being translated correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If your personal profile has the "Polski" language chosen, the comment notification has the wrong wording for the Polish word "comment". 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your [Personal Settings|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings] in id.atlassian.com, and set your "Language" to "Polski".
 # Go to your instance, trigger a comment notification.
 # You will see the following:

!test.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The Polish word should be "*dodano 1 nowy komentarz*"
h3. Actual Results

What it actually shows is "*dodano 1 nowy koemntarz*"
h3. Workaround

None
h3. Condition

 - This only happens with an instance using the batch notification system as shown here: [Jira Emails Are Changing!|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing]

- If you add two or more comments, the batch message changes to "*dokonano 1 aktualizacji i dodano 2 now. koment.*."
fields.summary: Polish Comment Notification on the batched message has incorrect wording

fields.description:
The Customer notifications in the French language pack in Jira Service desk cloud adds some special characters into the email templates. 

Reported by: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8872
fields.summary: Customer notification in French language pack has special characters
